intro: Disterigma hiatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that are often borne on long, slender stems. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Disterigma hiatum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
